00038  * \file table.c
00039  * \brief Implementation for \ref PrivateTable module.

00046 // C library includes
00047 #include <stdio.h>
00048 #include <stdlib.h>
00049 #include <string.h>

00051 // fc library dependencies
00052 #include "base.h"
00053 #include "storage.h"

00056 // this module
00057 #include "tableP.h"
00058 
00059 /** 
00060  * \addtogroup PrivateTable
00061  * \brief Routines for manipulating the table data structures.
00062  *
00063  * \description
00064  *  
00065  *   The primary data structures for FCLib are managed as "tables" (arrays) of
00066  *   "slots" (structs), which are structures that hold metadata and data 
00067  *   corresponding to that data entity type (i.e. _FC_DsSlot, _FC_SeqSlot, 
00068  *   _FC_MeshSlot, _FC_SubSlot, _FC_VarSlot). For more
00069  *   information about what information each type of slot holds, see the
00070  *   documentation on the struct definitions.
00071  *
00072  *   All slot types have a common header (_FC_SlotHeader) as the
00073  *   their first member. This allows us to 
00074  *   make some general purpose utility routines which work on any slot type.
00075  *   The header also contains information about the state of a slot like
00076  *   whether it can be modified on disk (writable), and whether the disk 
00077  *   version matches the current version (committed).
00078  *
00079  *   Any table consists of an array of pointers to the appropriate slot
00080  *   type. The tables are expanded as necessary by doubling the number of
00081  *   entries at a time. Entries start with a NULL value and are allocated as
00082  *   needed. The slots of "Deleted" slots are freed and set back to NULL.
00083  *
00084  *   Each table has supporting data structures - xTableSize is the length
00085  *   of the table; xOpenSlots is a sorted array of available slots.
00086  *
00087  *   Generic versions of basic table operations are defined in this module
00088  *   (like get a new slot or delete a slot). These basic operations take
00089  *   a specific kind of table and the necessary supporting information.
00090  *   To simplify matters, each kind of data (dataset, mesh, etc) has
00091  *   a wrapper that does the operation on that type of table (e.g. 
00092  *   _fc_getNewDsSlot() does _fc_getNewSlot() with the dataset table).
00093  *
00094  *   The data tables are not exposed at the user level and are 
00095  *   instead manipulated by \ref Handles which contain just enough information
00096  *   for called routines to locate the appropriate slot in the tables
00097  *   (i.e. the index into the table and a unique sequence number to make sure 
00098  *   the slot still refers to the same entity).
00099  */
00100 
00101 /**
00102  * \ingroup PrivateTable
00103  * \brief Master unique ID
00104  *
00105  * \description
00106  *
00107  *   Each slot has a unique ID which is checked against
00108  *   when dereferencing a handle. Each uID is only used
00109  *   once, so this master uID keeps track of the next
00110  *   available number. uIDs start at 1 and go up. (Start
00111  *   with 1 so anything initialized with 0 won't be accidentally o.k.
00112  */
00113 static int next_uID = 1;   
00114 
00115 /**
00116  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00117  * \brief  Replaces the name for a slot header with a copy of the input
00118  *
00119  * \description
00120  *  
00121  *    Takes a name, allocates space for the name (realloc if
00122  *    a name is already set) and copies it (user is still
00123  *    responsible for input char string).
00124  *
00125  *    This replaces the current name (and frees that memory). 
00126  *    Make sure to call this only if header has been initialized
00127  *    at some point with header.name = NULL.
00128  *
00129  * \modifications
00130  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
00131  */
00132 FC_ReturnCode _fc_setSlotHeaderName(
00133   _FC_SlotHeader *header,   /**< input/output - pointer to a slot header */
00134   char *name                /**< input - name to set */
00135 ) {
00136   // check input
00137   if (!header || !name) {
00138     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00139     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00140   }
00141   
00142   // delete the current name
00143   if (header->name)
00144     free(header->name);
00145   
00146   // copy the name
00147   header->name = malloc(strlen(name) + 1);
00148   if (header->name == NULL) {
00149     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00150     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00151   }
00152   strcpy(header->name, name);
00153   
00154   return FC_SUCCESS;
00155 }
00156 
00157 /**
00158  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00159  * \brief  Initialize a table header
00160  *
00161  * \description
00162  *  
00163  *    Sets all table header values to appropriate default values.
00164  *    Except the slot number and the unique ID which should only be set by 
00165  *    _fc_new_xxxSlot.
00166  *
00167  * \modifications  
00168  *   APR-29-2003  W Koegler  Created. Moved code from getnextslot
00169  *
00170  */
00171 void _fc_initSlotHeader(
00172   _FC_SlotHeader *header  /**< input - the slotheader to initialize */
00173 ) {
00174   if (header != NULL) {
00175     // header->slot is NOT changed
00176     // header->uID is NOT changed 
00177     header->name = NULL;
00178     header->committed = 0;
00179   }   
00180 }
00181 
00182 /**
00183  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00184  * \brief  Clear a slot header's
00185  *
00186  * \description
00187  *  
00188  *    Releases all dynamically allocated resources in a 
00189  *    table header, and reinitializes all members.
00190  *
00191  * \modifications  
00192  *   - APR-29-2003  W Koegler  Created. 
00193  *   - 2003-APR-31  W Koegler  Made more comprehensive
00194  */
00195 void _fc_clearSlotHeader(
00196   _FC_SlotHeader *header  /**< input/output - the slotheader to clear */
00197 ) {
00198   if (header != NULL) {
00199     // free dynamically allocated arrays
00200     if (header->name)
00201       free(header->name);
00202     
00203     // reinitialize
00204     _fc_initSlotHeader(header);
00205     
00206     // make "empty"
00207     header->uID = -1;
00208     // do NOT change header->slotID: for as long as the slot exists
00209     // it's slot ID is set and should stay the same
00210   }   
00211 }
00212 
00213 /**
00214  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00215  * \brief  Print the contents of an _FC_SlotHeader to stderr.
00216  *
00217  * \description
00218  *  
00219  *    This is a helper routine for the _fc_printXTable routines, used
00220  *    to print _FC_SlotHeader information (all table have an _FC_SlotHeader).
00221  *    It is meant to be called from these routines and wont' have pretty
00222  *    formatting if called on its own; but the info will be right.
00223  *
00224  * \modifications  
00225  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
00226  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Fixed up.
00227  *    - 12/03/03 WSK Fixed up some more.
00228  */
00229 void _fc_printSlotHeader(
00230   _FC_SlotHeader header 
00231 ) {
00232   fprintf(stderr, "     name = '%s'\n", header.name);
00233   fprintf(stderr, "     slotID = %d, uID = %d, committed = %d\n", 
00234           header.slotID, header.uID, header.committed);
00235   fflush(NULL);
00236 }
00237 
00238 /**
00239  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00240  * \brief   Get an empty slot from table.
00241  *
00242  * \description
00243  *  
00244  *    Code to get an empty slot from any type of table. It first checks
00245  *    for an unused spot (either the entry is NULL or has a unique
00246  *    ID less than 0). If there are no unused slots, it grows the table
00247  *    by factor of 2. If the unused slot is NULL, it allocates a
00248  *    new slot.
00249  *
00250  * \modifications 
00251  *    - 5/11/04 WSK  Moved common code from _fc_getNewDsSlot(), 
00252  *      _fc_getNewSeqSlot(), _fc_getNewMeshSlot() & _fc_getNewVarSlot() to
00253  *      here.
00254  */
00255 _FC_SlotHeader* _fc_getNewSlot(
00256    int* tableSize,           /**< input/output: pointer to table size  */
00257    _FC_SlotHeader*** table,  /**< input/output: pointer to table */
00258    FC_SortedIntArray* openSlots,     /**< input/output:  sia holds
00259                     indices of available slots */
00260    int slotSize              /**< input: size of a slot */
00261 ) {
00262   int i;
00263   int slotID, newSize, ret;
00264   void *temp;
00265 
00266   // get an unused slot
00267   if (openSlots->numVal > 0) {
00268     slotID = openSlots->vals[0];
00269     fc_popSortedIntArrayFront(openSlots);
00270   }
00271   else { // if an unused slot doesn't exist, make some more slots
00272     if (*tableSize == 0)
00273       newSize = 1;
00274     else
00275       newSize = 2*(*tableSize);
00276     temp = realloc(*table, newSize*sizeof(_FC_SlotHeader*));
00277     if (temp == NULL) {
00278       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00279       return NULL;
00280     }
00281     *table = temp;
00282     for (i = (*tableSize); i < newSize; i++)
00283       (*table)[i] = NULL;
00284     // NOTE! the ID of the first new slot doesn't get added to openSlots
00285     slotID = (*tableSize);
00286     for (i = newSize-1; i > (*tableSize); i--) {
00287       ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(openSlots, i);
00288       if (ret < 0) {
00289      fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add key to sia, memory error?");
00290      return NULL; // an error occured
00291       }
00292       else if (ret == 0) {
00293      fprintf(stderr, "***developer note: Algorithmic error! shouldn't reach here!");
00294      fflush(NULL);
00295       }
00296     }
00297     (*tableSize) = newSize;
00298   }
00299 
00300   // allocate slot if necessary
00301   if ((*table)[slotID] == NULL) {
00302     (*table)[slotID] = malloc(slotSize);
00303     if ((*table)[slotID] == NULL) {
00304       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00305       return NULL;
00306     }
00307   }
00308         
00309   // setup the slot
00310   _fc_initSlotHeader((*table)[slotID]);
00311   (*table)[slotID]->slotID = slotID;
00312   (*table)[slotID]->uID = next_uID;
00313   next_uID++;
00314 
00315   return (*table)[slotID];
00316 }
00317 
00318 /**
00319  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00320  * \brief   Check that a handle is valid.
00321  *
00322  * \description 
00323  * 
00324  *    Returns 1 if the handle is valid and 0 if it is not. Valid means that the
00325  *    object exists and that it has the same uID as the handle (this extra
00326  *    check is necessary because the slot may get reused, at which time the
00327  *    handle is invalid even though it refers to a real object).
00328  *
00329  * \modifications 
00330  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Created.
00331  */
00332 int _fc_isHandleValid(
00333    int slotID,             /**< input: slot id from a handle  */
00334    int uID,                /**< input: unique id from a handle */
00335    int tableSize,          /**< input: the table size  */
00336    _FC_SlotHeader** table  /**< input: the table */
00337 ) {
00338   if (slotID < 0 || slotID >= tableSize || !table[slotID] ||
00339       table[slotID]->uID != uID)
00340     return 0;
00341   else
00342     return 1;
00343 }
00344 
00345 /**
00346  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00347  * \brief   Get a slot by ID.
00348  *
00349  * \description  
00350  *
00351  *    Returns a slot if it exists (exists means has some thing in it and
00352  *    therefore the uID will be 1 or greater. Otherwise returns NULL.
00353  *
00354  * \modifications 
00355  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Created.
00356  */
00357 _FC_SlotHeader* _fc_getSlot(
00358    int slotID,             /**< input: slot id  */
00359    int tableSize,          /**< input: the table size  */
00360    _FC_SlotHeader** table  /**< input: the table */
00361 ) {
00362   if (slotID < 0 || slotID >= tableSize || !table[slotID] ||
00363       table[slotID]->uID < 1)
00364     return NULL;
00365   else
00366     return table[slotID];
00367 }
00368 
00369 /**
00370  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00371  * \brief   Delete the contents of a slot
00372  *
00373  * \description  
00374  *
00375  *    If the slot exists, deletes the memory associated with
00376  *    that slot and add the slotID to the openSlots lists.
00377  *
00378  *    Assumes that dynamic data in the slot has already been
00379  *    "cleared".
00380  *
00381  * \modifications 
00382  *    - 12/20/05 WSD Created.
00383  */
00384 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteSlot(
00385    int slotID,             /**< input: slot id  */
00386    int tableSize,          /**< input: the table size  */
00387    _FC_SlotHeader** table, /**< input: the table */
00388    FC_SortedIntArray* openSlots  /**< input/output: the open slots */
00389 ) {
00390   int ret;
00391 
00392   if (slotID >= 0 && slotID < tableSize && table[slotID]) {
00393     free(table[slotID]);
00394     table[slotID] = NULL;
00395     ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(openSlots, slotID);
00396     if (ret < 0) {
00397       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add ID to sia");
00398       return ret; // an error occured
00399     }
00400     else if (ret == 0) {
00401       fprintf(stderr, "***developer note: Algorithmic error! shouldn't reach here!");
00402       fflush(NULL);
00403     }
00404   }
00405   
00406   return FC_SUCCESS;
00407 }
